fields.description:
Have you done the changes we proposed for VPC part?

At least some links in VPC go to the mido 5.1/latest instead of the 1.9 version of midonet.

(This might be mentioned in another DOC ticket but just want to ensure that this is addressed - link to correct version of midonet.)

Will use this ticket to also ensure that the 1.9 version requirement is mentioned in Install topic, as well as the Compat Matrix. (EUCA-12614)
fields.summary: VPC docs - correct version of MidoNet: MEM v1.9

comments.body:
[~tsugawa] I've checked through global searches and it appears that all the Midokura links are now pointing to the proper places for the 4.3.0 release. Please let me know if you find anything still needing a fix. 
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/index.html

This may be another ticket, but in
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html

There is no need for:
{code}
[midokura-misc]
name=midokura Misc Package Repo
baseurl=http://repo.midonet.org/misc/RHEL/7/misc/
gpgkey=http://repo.midonet.org/RPM-GPG-KEY-midokura
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
metadata_expire=1
{code}
@shaon and [~mbacchi], please confirm the above.
[~shaon] please take a look at [~tsugawa]'s comment and let me know. thanks!
[~kmeredith], yep, that's repo is not needed. We don't use this repo for setups in QA.

The Planning and Install sections now point to the Compatibility Matrix, where version 1.9 is listed as the supported version. (I've been working toward removing version-specific compat info within the doc content, to the Compat Matrix wherever possible, as a background task (DOC-1788))

http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#release-notes/4.3.0/4.3.0_rn_compatibility_matrix.html

Also removed {code}
[midokura-misc]
name=midokura Misc Package Repo
baseurl=http://repo.midonet.org/misc/RHEL/7/misc/
gpgkey=http://repo.midonet.org/RPM-GPG-KEY-midokura
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
metadata_expire=1
{code} from prereq topic

[~tsugawa] now that I re-read your comments in EUCA-12614, it makes me wonder if we should state anything about the open-source versions. We do not mention any that work (or might work, albeit untested). And in this topic: [MidoNet Software Version|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html] ... if you did not read closely, you might think we are suggesting using the open-source version just as much as MEM. (Should we even mention the open-source version?)

Looks good to me. [~tsugawa] should probably have the final say here, specially on the [Preparing VPC page|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html]

[~kmeredith] I think for this release it would be best to not mention open source MidoNet to avoid confusion. It is important to convey that  Eucalyptus 4.3 VPCMIDO mode:

1. was tested and validated using MEM v1.9 series
2. was tested and known that is imcompatible with MEM v5 series
3. will have unknown behavior with other MidoNet versions/releases (most likely will not work)

Other include open-source releases.

Updated - will appear in next doc build.

Remove open source mentions:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html 
{quote}MidoNet is an open-source network virtualization platform{quote}
and
{quote}Open Source MidoNet (available at http://www.midonet.org){quote}

Clarify MidoNet is MEM, not open-source:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/planning_networking_modes.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/system_requirements.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#release-notes/4.3.0/4.3.0_rn_compatibility_matrix.html

Fix shortdesc
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_component_topology.html
OK I think I've got it all covered now. Let me know if you spot any errors or omissions. thanks

Just FYI on Cassandra and Zookeeper version #s.

there is no specific version in MidoNet docs, so it is the version on the repositories. Zookeeper comes from MEM repository, while Cassandra comes from Apache (DataStax)

http://docs.midokura.com/docs/latest/quick-start-guide/rhel-7_kilo-rdo/content/_cassandra_installation.html says dsc22
Adding Cassandra and ZooKeeper vers. to VPCMIDO note in compat matrix.
